bibl.title: Letter from Frederick L. Rath, Jr., to Maria Teresa Rojas, April 16, 1952

div1.p: Rath informs Rojas of his travel arrangements and sends a photograph so that she will recognize him.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick L. Rath, Jr., to Maria Teresa Rojas, April 16, 1952
div1.opener:
April 16, 1952
Senora Maria Teresa Rojas
Finca San Jose
Calzada Real y Gomez Redencion
Quemados de Marianao
Havana, Cuba
My dear Senora Rojas:
div1.p:
It is a very great pleasure for me to anticipate our
meeting at the end of the month. I have made arrangements to fly
from Miami on the morning of April 29, via Pan American Airways,
arriving at Havana Airport at 9:15 a.m.

I have obtained a reservation for a return flight on the
morning of May 1st, so that we shall have two full days in which to
discuss our mutual interests. I have always been somewhat amused
by the fact that many persons who have never met me look for a
rather elderly gentleman. To save possible embarrassment, I am en-
closing a fairly recent photograph, which I am told is a reasonable
likeness.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours Frederick L. Rath, Jr.
Director FLR:M
cc: Dr. P. S. Hench
